Package ePortfolio

Class Investment

  • java.lang.Object
    • ePortfolio.Investment
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MutualFund, Stock
    public abstract class Investment
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an abstract investment.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected double bookValue
      A double variable attribute containing the last updated bookvalue of the Investment.

      A double variable attribute containing the last updated gain of the Investment.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Investment

        public Investment​(java.lang.String symbol,
                  java.lang.String name,
                  double price)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        This constructor declares a new Investment object and initializes its symbol, name and price. The Investment's symbol is initialized with the symbol argument. The Investment's name is initialized with the name argument.
        Parameters:
        symbol - a String object containing the symbol of the Investment
        name - a String object containing the name of the Investment
        price - a double variable containing the initial price of the Investment
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

           throws java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:
        symbol - a String object containing the symbol of the Investment
        name - a String object containing the name of the Investment
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • buy

        public void buy​(int quantity)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        This method performs a purchase operation on the calling Investment object. The quantity is added to the existing quantity attribute. The bookValue attribute is updated by adding the book value of the purchase. The gain on investment attribute is updated using the new quantity.
        Parameters:
        quantity - An intger variable containing the required purchase quantity of the Investment.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • buy

        public void buy​(double price,
                int quantity)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        This method performs a purchase operation on the calling Investment object. A new price is set to the Investment object. The quantity is added to the existing quantity attribute. The bookValue attribute is updated by adding the book value of the purchase. The gain on investment attribute is updated using the new quantity.
        Parameters:
        price - A double varianle containing the required purchase price of the Investment.
        quantity - An intger variable containing the required purchase quantity of the Investment.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • sell

        public void sell​(int quantity,
                 double price)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method performs a sell operation on the calling Investment object. A new price is set to the Investment object. The quantity is deducted from the existing quantity attribute. The bookValue attribute is updated by deducting the book value of the quantity sold. The gain on investment attribute is updated using the new quantity.
        Parameters:
        quantity - An intger variable containing the required purchase quantity of the Investment.
        price - A double variable containing the selling price.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • sell

        public void sell​(int quantity)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method performs a sell operation on the calling Investment object. The method uses the current Investment price attribute as the selling price. The quantity is deducted from the existing quantity attribute. The bookValue attribute is updated by deducting the book value of the quantity sold. The gain on investment attribute is updated using the new quantity.
        Parameters:
        quantity - An intger variable containing the required purchase quantity of the Investment.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • isValidQuantity

        public boolean isValidQuantity​(int quantity)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Method checks if quantity is valid. It returns true if quantity is positive or 0 Returns false if quantity is negative
        Parameters:
        quantity - An integer variable containing the quantity to be checked.
        Returns:
        A boolean value that indicates the validity of the quantity parameter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object other)
        Method checks if another Investment object is equal to calling Investment object. It ignores cases in the comparison between Strings. It returns true if objects are equal. Returns false if objects aren't equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other - Another Investment object to be compared with the calling object.
        Returns:
        A boolean value that indicates the parameter is equal to the calling object.

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.String symbol,
                      java.lang.String name)
        Method checks if symbol and name parameters are equivalent to the symbol and name of the calling Investment object. It ignores cases in the comparison between the Strings. Parameters don't have to be assigned a valid String. In case the parameters meet the criteria of isNull method, they get skipped in the compaarison. It returns true if Strings are equal. Returns false if Strings aren't equal.
        Parameters:
        symbol - A String object containing the symbol to be checked.
        name - A String containing the name to be checked.
        Returns:
        A boolean value that indicates the parameters equal the attributes.

      • equalSymbol

        public boolean equalSymbol​(java.lang.String symbol)
        Method checks if symbol parameter is equal to symbol attribute of the Investment object. It ignores cases in the comparison between the 2 Strings It returns true if Strings are equal. Returns false if Strings aren't equal.
        Parameters:
        symbol - A String object containing the symbol to be checked.
        Returns:
        A boolean value that indicates the parameter is equal to the symbol attribute.

      • isNull

        protected static boolean isNull​(java.lang.String string)
        Protected method used as criteria for other methods in class/subclasses. It checks if a String is null, empty or consists of spaces only. If it matches the criteria above, true is returned. If String contains other chars then false is returned.
        Parameters:
        A - String object passed from another method.
        Returns:
        Boolean value indicating String criteria match.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method adds all the attributes of the calling Investment object to a String object and returns it.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String object containing all the attribute values of the calling object.
